attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique code for each baseline program project funded through the SC MPA Baseline Program. This code refers to a specific entry on the SC_MPA_BaselineProgramInformation_LookupTable.
Unique site code that indicates where the Long-Term Monitoring survey was done. this site code refers to a specific entry on the sc_mpa_intertidal_site_table.
Consecutive sampling number. A code created to allow sequencing of the seasons, used for sorting data in chronological order.
A four-character code to identify the Sampling season. The first two characters indicate the season and the last 2 characters indicate the year

textDomain.definition: Two character season, eg. FA for Fall, followed by two digit year, eg. 10 for 2010

attribute.attributeDefinition: The four digit calendar year for this sample season. The sample season is designated by the survey team, and may not indicate the actual survey year. For example, surveys conducted in January, 2008 may have a sample season year of 2007. This year is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in local time. Local time is Pacific Standard Time except during months when Pacific Daylight Time is effective.
The Season sequence within each year. Each number indicates a different season.

codeDefinition.definition: Survey conducted in the Spring, generally between February and May
Survey conducted in the Summer, generally between June and September
Survey conducted in the Fall, generally between October and January
Survey conducted in the Winter, generally between December and January. This season is not always used. If it is used, it will overlap Fall and Spring.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The specific organism that this transect was created to monitor.

textDomain.definition: Name of the organism as identified on the Integrated Taxonomic Information System (ITIS, http://www.itis.usda.gov). In cases where substrate or other non taxonomic name is used, classification determined by the survey team.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Replicate transect number, starting from 1. In general, the length of the transect is 10 meters.

attribute.attributeLabel: Long Term Monitoring Survey Species Code
attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique code that indicates the organism or characteristic being identified. This code refers to a specific entry on the class table.

textDomain.definition: Name of the organism as identified on the Integrated Taxonomic Information System (ITIS, http://www.itis.usda.gov). In cases where substrate or other non taxonomic name is used, classification determined by the survey team.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The percent cover count of the organism indicated by the Species field (Number of hits of a given species/Total hits of all species)
Used to modify the associated numeric field (counts/percent encountered).
The method used for sampling the transect.

codeDefinition.definition: Transect 10 Meter 1000 1cm segments scored (most abund taxon in each segment recorded), not point contact
